metadata.dc:author: Fuentes Pradera, M A
Ortega Ruiz, F
Otero Candelera, R
Franco, E
metadata.dc:description: Pulmonary arteriovenous fistula in a 63-year-old woman with no relevant medical history presented with neurological symptoms secondary to multiple polymicrobial abscesses. As a result of this finding, relatives were examined under suspicion of the presence of systemic angiomatosis (hemorrhagic hereditary telangiectasia or Rendu-Osler-Weber disease), which is asymptomatic in many victims. Follow-up and early diagnosis is crucial to preventing severe neurological complications by treatment of arteriovenous malformations and antibiotic prophylaxis during dental or other invasive procedures.
metadata.dc:title: Absceso cerebral como primera manifestación de una fístula arteriovenosa pulmonar familiar.
[Cerebral abscess as first manifestation of a familial pulmonary arteriovenous fistula].
